definition: to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
(coll.) foot of an animal or bird/(coll.) foot supporting a cooking pot etc
foot of a bird or animal/paw/claws/talons
to grab/to capture
to arrest
to grasp firmly/to pay special attention to/to rush in/to make the most of
to seize/to capture
starting point/mechanical hand/gripper
to arrest
snatch (weightlifting technique)
to be in charge of/to concentrate on
to attempt all tasks at once/to manage every detail regardless of its importance
to seize
to draw straws
to make up a prescription (of herbal medicine)
to scratch/to mess about with/to quarrel/to scramble to do/sb or sth that one can rely on
pilaf (rice dish popular in many parts of the world, including Xinjiang)/pilau
to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)

sentences.english: In order to make strong shot, a player must be able to hold racket very hard.
sentences.chinese: 爲了擊球有力，選手必須將拍子抓得非常緊。

sentences.english: Love the neighbor. But don't get caught.
sentences.chinese: 愛你的鄰居，不過不要被抓包。

sentences.english: Grasping the "Five Constructions", Promoting the "Three Services", Setting up Good Image.
sentences.chinese: 抓“五項建設”，促“三個服務”，樹良好形象。

sentences.english: The grip cover lies directly over the hammering end of the tool.
sentences.chinese: 抓地力覆蓋在於直接在錘打結束工具。

sentences.english: I catch a watch in the scratching match.
sentences.chinese: 我在抓癢比賽中抓到一塊手錶。

sentences.english: Serving multiple appetizers and finger foods cuts down on your work.
sentences.chinese: 提供多種開胃菜和能減少你工作量的手抓食物。

sentences.english: The cop caught thief in the market.
sentences.chinese: 警察在市場裏抓到了小偷。

sentences.english: If being ugly were a crime, I'd have to arrest half the people in this city.
sentences.chinese: 如果相貌醜也要抓，那這城裏一半人都要蹲牢裏了。

sentences.english: We must emphasize basic management pragmatic, no sophistry is allowed and rash.
sentences.chinese: 抓基礎管理一定要強調務實，來不得半點虛假和浮躁。

sentences.english: They firmly took hold of all the lifelines of their national economy.
sentences.chinese: 他們把國民經濟的命脈都牢牢抓到自己手中。

sentences.english: But size matters little when it comes to eating the crabs at the end of the safari.
sentences.chinese: 但當談到抓到以後喫螃蟹時大小並無關緊要。

sentences.english: A group of great scientists lived in heaven after dearth.
sentences.chinese: 一羣偉大的科學家死後在天堂裏抓迷藏。

sentences.english: I was sliding everywhere, with absolutely no grip at all.
sentences.chinese: 賽車根本沒有抓地力，我一直在不斷的打滑。

sentences.english: Determined, the blonde turned and headed for the swamps, set on catching herself an alligator.
sentences.chinese: 女郎咬咬牙，回身向沼澤地走去，準備親手抓只鱷魚。
他們成功地抓到了那個賊。

sentences.english: Once the project is completed, they are off to the next hot opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 項目一旦完成，他們就散夥去抓下一個熱門的機會。

definition: to grab/to capture
to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
to fish up/to dredge up
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to run away/to take to one's heels
to hide/to dodge/to avoid
to grab
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
to kill/to beat to death
variant of 捏[nie1]
to lift/to carry in one's hand/Taiwan pr. [ling1]
to grasp firmly/to pay special attention to/to rush in/to make the most of
to watch sb closely/to breathe down sb's neck/to mark (sports)
to pick (flowers)/to pinch/to nip/to pinch off/to clutch/(slang) to fight
